result_list.explanation: The stage direction describes a general character action, 'fait le signe de la Croix' (makes the sign of the Cross), which fits into the action category.
result_list.stgdir: Corbineli fait le signe de la Croix.

result_list.explanation: The stage direction describes the physical setting of the scene, specifying the room furnishings and items on a desk.
result_list.stgdir: Le théâtre représente une chambre simplement meublée. Sur un des côtés de la scène est un grand bureau de travail, couvert de cartes, de livres, de globes et d'instruments de mathématiques.

result_list.explanation: The stage direction begins with 'AIR,' indicating a musical direction, which fits into the music category.
This stage direction provides a narrative description of the setting and time ('sur le navire nommé Le Saint-Jean de la Rochelle, au petit matin...'), making it fit into the narration category.
result_list.stgdir: Sur le navire nommé Le Saint-Jean de la Rochelle, au petit matin, avec du brouillard. Il fait frais, le 14 juillet 1650. Le Saint-Jean repartira le 23 août.

result_list.explanation: The stage direction 'Apercevant Adélaïde' describes a non-verbal interaction, as someone perceives or notices Adélaïde.
The action 'Elle se jette aux pieds de Saint-Albin' (She throws herself at Saint-Albin's feet) is a general character action and fits the action category.
result_list.stgdir: Elle se jette aux pieds de Saint-Albin.

result_list.explanation: The stage direction indicates that the character exits with another, 'Elle sort avec sa soeur,' which fits into the exit category.
result_list.stgdir: Elle sort avec sa soeur, en éclatant de rire.

result_list.explanation: The stage direction is introduced by 'AIR,' indicating it refers to a musical piece or song, which fits into the music category.
result_list.stgdir: AIR. Marguerite, ma Mie, olire, olire.

result_list.explanation: The stage direction 'S'approchant de Mariette' describes a character's movement toward someone, which fits the movement category.
The phrase 'À la statue de Pompée' indicates the addressee or the direction of attention or speech, corresponding to the toward category.
